newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber prices end up on covering.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber prices end up on covering.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices ended higher but for the first time in weeks, the rise was aided by a slight return in buying interest, traders said.
"Australians and Koreans were in the market today, doing some light covering for a few hundred tonnes of SMR 20," said a trader.

"We can't really say they are chasing, but some covering has started and hopefully will pick up," he said, adding that the calling price was 306 cents ($1.21) a kg, the same as the market offer price for SMR 20.
Traders offered SMR 10 at 309 cents, SMR 5 at 322, SMR L at 343, SMR CV at 363 and drum latex at 234.

At the close, the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board (MRELB) quoted market indicator price for November RSS 1 buyer at 314.50 cents a kg, up 1.50 cents from Wednesday. November SMR 20 was half cent higher at 310.
The INRO five-day average rose to 241.03 Malaysian/Singapore cents per kg on Oct 30 from 240.25 on Oct 29. The daily indicator price was at 242.83 against 242.88.
